intro: Ruellia glomerata, commonly known as clustered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the warm regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually violet or blue in color, blooming from summer to fall. Ruellia glomerata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
